title: Help Needed.
body:
Every time I try and play a game of LoL it crashes right at the champion portrait screen and gives me an error message that reads:
"An unknown DirectX error has occurred and League of Legends cannot start. Please make sure your video card is using the latest video drivers from the manufacturer."
I have updated everything its asking for yet it still tends to show up. 
The only thing is due to my laptop breaking down im using a kinda run down pc which had 2 Gb ram and windows xp and it worked smoothly. I then gave it to a shop to get windows 7 and since then its not working and giving me that error despite of me having all the drivers needed. would really love some solutions 
ty

replies.body: It sounds like the game is failing to render and resulting in a crash, so performing updates is definitely a solid step.  I also recommend going through the [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) guide for additional steps and possibilities to rule out like game files or hardware issues.  Let me know how that works out, as well as using the HRT.

Downloading* the hextech tool now. 
Well it was ages since i used xp and wasnt liking it much thats why i shifted to w7
should have kept xp. it's a low-resource OS. Win 7 is not.

I'd recommend you try the LoL hextech repair tool (sorry, can't find a link to it).

######I'd also recommend you put this in Report a Bug from now on. :)
